description: Common-Source Voltage Amplifier with resistive load

impact.VoltageGain: Higher VDD allows for more voltage headroom
impact.PowerConsumption: Higher VDD directly increases power consumption

impact.VoltageGain: Affects bias point and transistor operation region
impact.PowerConsumption: Affects drain current and power consumption

impact.VoltageGain: Increasing Wn increases transconductance (gm) which increases gain
impact.Bandwidth: Increasing Wn increases gate capacitance which decreases bandwidth
impact.PowerConsumption: Increasing Wn increases current which increases power consumption

impact.VoltageGain: Increasing Rd increases voltage gain (Av = -gm × Rd)
impact.Bandwidth: Increasing Rd increases output RC time constant which decreases bandwidth

trade_offs: Higher gain typically comes at cost of reduced bandwidth
Higher gain typically requires higher power consumption
Higher bandwidth typically comes at cost of reduced gain
Higher bandwidth typically requires higher power consumption

high_gain: Increase Rd to maximum acceptable value
high_bandwidth: Decrease Rd to reduce RC time constant
Increase VDD to support higher current
Adjust Vgate to increase drain current
low_power: Increase Rd to maintain gain with lower current
balanced_performance: Adjust Wn and Vgate for required gain-bandwidth product

limited_voltage_swing.description: Output signal may clip if input is too large
solutions: Ensure proper biasing with appropriate Vgate
